list_definition.definition: something that cannot be, or has not been, explained

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the mystery of how the universe was formed
How she passed her exam is a mystery to me.

list_definition.definition: the quality of being impossible to explain, understand etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her death was surrounded by mystery.

list_ex_of_english: At the same time, the cosmic dimension looks forward to the mysteries of finitude and beyond.
Modern science has made it possible to look beneath the tissues of the human body, and has aided surgery in telling of the hidden mysteries.
Linguistics and cognitive science: problems and mysteries.
Superficiality is poor company for medicine, but mysteries are worse.
The material means of music are rationally quantifiable but not the mysteries of their application.
In this reading, the libretto acts as the direct model for the music and the music's essence lies in its capacity to shadow the text and to represent its mysteries.
By reason of this terror the savage trembled before the magician who seemed to have penetrated the mysteries of nature about him.
We enjoy mysteries, so long as they do not threaten our person.
